article.headline: UC Santa Barbara 79, Ball St. 52
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) -- Chris Devine and Alex Harris scored 22 points each as UC Santa Barbara beat Ball State 79-52 Wednesday night. The Gauchos, who led 35-20 at halftime, shot 77.8 percent from 3-point range after the break. UC Santa Barbara (10-1) shot 12-of-19 from beyond the arc for the game and 27-of-51 from the field overall. The Gauchos shot 81.3 percent from the free-throw line to score 13 points. Jordan Weiner had 12 points and Ivan Elliott 10 for UC Santa Barbara, which outrebounded Ball State 33-28. Justin Joyner had six assists. Peyton Stovall scored 18 points for Ball State (0-10). Melvin Goins had 10 for the Cardinals, who managed just 37.5 percent shooting from the field.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
